question.title: Will the WHO declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, not a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that does not specifically address the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the WHO not declare the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa a global emergency by August 2024?
not_P.body:

1. The WHO must not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Rift Valley fever outbreak in East Africa is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must not specifically refer to the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak, but rather to a global Rift Valley fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Rift Valley fever that specifically addresses the East African outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the East African Rift Valley fever outbreak a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the WHO announce that the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa is no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be resolved as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa is no longer regarded as a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must issue a public statement clearly indicating that the Rift Valley fever situation in East Africa is no longer classified as a global emergency.
2. This statement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The statement must specifically mention the East African Rift Valley fever situation, not a general global Rift Valley fever issue.

The inquiry will be resolved as NO if:
1. The WHO does not issue such a statement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO issues a statement regarding Rift Valley fever that does not specifically pertain to the East African situation.
3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency status of the East African Rift Valley fever situation.

Note: If the WHO has previously declared the East African Rift Valley fever situation no longer a global emergency before the start date of this inquiry, the resolution will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Russia's Federation Council pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Putin by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia's Federation Council passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Vladimir Putin or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Federation Council, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

3. The opposition from President Putin or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Russian economy.

If such a bill is passed by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

If no such legislation is enacted by the Federation Council by August 31, 2024, or if a legislation is enacted but fails to satisfy all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry resolves as negative.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of Mexico officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. question.title: Will the median Canadian home price reach a new record high by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the median price of existing homes sold in Canada reaches a new record high, surpassing any previous monthly median price on record. The median price refers to the middle price in the range of home prices sold, where half of the homes sold for more and half sold for less. If no new record high is reported by the resolution date, or if the highest reported median price does not exceed the current record, the question resolves as NO. question.title: Will the Reserve Bank of India announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Reserve Bank of India officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Reserve Bank of India or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual RBI members will not count for resolution. question.title: Will General Motors resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if General Motors reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of General Motors workers (at least 1,000 participants).

question.title: Will Texas hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Texas officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will neither of the following occur by their respective dates: (a) Texas holds a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024 (b) The Teamsters Union endorses a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if neither of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, Texas does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on abortion rights. The referendum must not be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must not be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must not directly address abortion rights, either proposing to enshrine protections or to restrict/ban abortion. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on abortion does not qualify; it must not be a specific referendum on the issue. If such a referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Teamsters Union does not publicly endorse a candidate for the 2024 United States presidential election. The endorsement must not be confirmed through official Teamsters Union statements or reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must not clearly indicate support for a specific candidate in the 2024 presidential race. If such an endorsement is made or publicly announced by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that this question does not consider hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be considered for resolution.

para_P.title: Is there a chance that either of the following will happen by their deadlines: (a) Texas will conduct a referendum regarding abortion rights by August 2024 (b) The Teamsters Union will support a candidate for the 2024 US presidential election by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following takes place: (a) By the date of August 31, 2024, Texas holds a statewide public referendum specifically addressing abortion rights. The referendum must directly deal with abortion rights, either aiming to establish protections or to limit/ban abortion. A general election featuring candidates with various views on abortion does not qualify; it must be a distinct referendum on the matter. If such a referendum does not occur by the stated date, or if a scheduled referendum is cancelled or postponed past August 31, 2024, the outcome will be NO. (b) By July 31, 2024, the Teamsters Union must publicly announce their endorsement of a candidate for the 2024 presidential election in the United States. This endorsement needs to be validated through official statements from the Teamsters Union or reported by at least two reputable news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Wall Street Journal). The endorsement must explicitly show support for a particular candidate in the 2024 presidential election. If no such endorsement is made or publicly declared by the resolution date, the outcome will be NO. It is important to note that this question does not take into account hypothetical or speculative endorsements; only official, public endorsements will be factored into the resolution.

question.title: Will Indiana hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

not_P.title: Will Indiana not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must not be formally announced by the Indiana state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Indiana-based news outlets). The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in Indiana and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will Indiana conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, Indiana officially carries out a statewide vote specifically addressing the inclusion of abortion rights in the state constitution. The vote must be formally announced by the Indiana state government and confirmed by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or prominent Indiana-based news outlets). The vote must be accessible to all eligible voters in Indiana and concentrate primarily on abortion rights. If no such vote takes place or is finalized by the resolution date, or if the vote is canceled or delayed beyond July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. It is important to note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the vote, not its result.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a healthy behavior incentive for beneficiaries. The healthy behavior incentive must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must be officially adopted, not merely proposed or under consideration. If no other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will no other U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a healthy behavior incentive by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, no U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a healthy behavior incentive for beneficiaries. The healthy behavior incentive must be a key component of the plan. For a positive resolution, there must be no official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, and no consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The plan must not be officially adopted, but merely proposed or under consideration. If at least one other state adopts such a plan by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for another U.S. state to implement a Medicaid program featuring a healthy behavior incentive before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state, excluding Georgia, formally implements a Medicaid program that incorporates a healthy behavior incentive for its beneficiaries. The healthy behavior incentive must be a fundamental aspect of the program. For an affirmative outcome, there needs to be an official declaration from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent coverage from a minimum of two credible national news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). The program must be officially enacted, rather than just proposed or under review. Should no other state establish such a program by July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme officially announces one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, not continuations of previously announced commitments. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments does not exceed $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the United Nations Development Programme not announce new funding commitments totaling over $400 million by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme does not officially announce one or more new funding commitments that collectively total more than $400 million. The announcement(s) must not be made through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) or not be reported by at least two reputable news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding commitments must not be new initiatives or significant expansions of existing programs, and must be continuations of previously announced commitments. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding commitments exceeds $400 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it expected that the United Nations Development Programme will reveal new funding pledges exceeding $400 million by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the United Nations Development Programme makes an official declaration of one or more new funding pledges that together surpass $400 million. The declaration(s) must occur through official UNDP channels (such as their website or press releases) and be covered by at least two credible news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The funding pledges must represent new initiatives or significant expansions of current programs, rather than extensions of previously announced pledges. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the total of new funding pledges does not exceed $400 million, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in France cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will a major hospital system in France not cancel over €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in France, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, does not successfully cancel more than €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple regions. The cancellation must not be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should not target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is €250 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a significant healthcare network in France to eliminate more than €250 million in medical debt by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, a healthcare network located in France, working alongside a nonprofit organization, successfully eliminates over €250 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across various regions. The cancellation must be publicly announced by the healthcare network or covered by a minimum of two major news organizations (such as Le Monde, Reuters, or other prominent national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially vulnerable or unable to pay. If the debt relief is not finalized or officially verified by the given date, or if the total amount canceled is €250 million or less, the inquiry will be considered negative.

question.title: Will Russia report a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports a successful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The success must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'successful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being at least 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season does not meet these criteria, or if insufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia report an unsuccessful winter crop season for wheat and barley by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia reports an unsuccessful winter crop season for wheat and barley, characterized by yields not meeting or exceeding the average of the past five years. The failure must be confirmed by official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or by fewer than three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). For this question, 'unsuccessful' is defined as the combined production of wheat and barley being less than 5% above the five-year average. If the winter crop season meets these criteria, or if sufficient data is available to make a determination, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will there be a declaration from Russia regarding a fruitful winter harvest for wheat and barley?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, Russia announces a fruitful winter harvest for wheat and barley, indicated by yields that meet or surpass the average of the last five years. Confirmation of success must come from official agricultural statistics from the Russian Ministry of Agriculture or at least three credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Economic Times). In this context, 'fruitful' means that the total output of wheat and barley is at least 5% higher than the five-year average. If the winter harvest does not fulfill these conditions, or if there is inadequate information to reach a conclusion, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will Russia announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian government officially announces plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The announcement must come from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The announcement must clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, not just expansions or modifications to the existing plans. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, or if the announcement only reaffirms or provides updates on the existing two-reactor plan, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Russia not announce plans to build additional nuclear reactors beyond the current two by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian government does not officially announce plans to build more nuclear reactors beyond the two currently planned. The absence of an announcement from an official government source, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and no reporting by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg) must occur. The announcement must not clearly indicate an intention to construct additional reactors beyond the two already planned, nor should it just reaffirm or provide updates on the existing two-reactor plan. If such an announcement is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Russia will declare intentions to develop more nuclear reactors in addition to the existing two by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Russian authorities formally declare intentions to construct further nuclear reactors in addition to the two currently proposed. The declaration must originate from an official governmental entity, such as the Kremlin or Rosatom, and be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Bloomberg). The statement must explicitly express a desire to build more reactors beyond the two already proposed, rather than merely suggesting expansions or alterations to the current plans. If no such declaration is made by the resolution date, or if the declaration merely reaffirms or updates the existing two-reactor proposal, the inquiry will conclude as NO.

question.title: Will Google lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will Google not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If Google confirms a higher number of layoffs, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Any layoffs or phased implementations that reach or exceed the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will Google terminate a minimum of 1,800 staff members by the end of July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with YES if, by July 31, 2024, Google has publicly acknowledged the termination of at least 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy centered around AI. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements by the company, regulatory documents, or reports from at least two credible news organizations (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be directly associated with the AI-centered reorganization plan revealed in 2023. If Google verifies a lesser number of layoffs, or if there is no confirmation that meets these stipulations by the resolution date, the question will be answered as NO. Any partial layoffs or gradual implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also lead to a NO resolution.

question.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank officially announces a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the South African Reserve Bank not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if the South African Reserve Bank does not officially announce a decrease in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must not be confirmed through official statements from the South African Reserve Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SARB members will not count for resolution. If such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that the South African Reserve Bank will declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if the South African Reserve Bank makes a formal announcement regarding a reduction in its repo rate by July 31, 2024. The declaration must be validated through official communications from the South African Reserve Bank or covered by at least two prominent financial news outlets (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Monetary Policy Committee and conveyed in their formal statement or press briefing following a meeting. Any conjecture about potential future rate reductions or informal remarks by individual SARB members will not be counted for resolution. question.title: Will Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Nissan Motor Co., Ltd. workers (at least 1,000 participants).

4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

question.title: Will the Central Bank of the Philippines announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Central Bank of the Philippines officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight reverse repurchase rate, which is the Central Bank of the Philippines' primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will large protests occur in Canada in response to environmental policy changes by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, there are credible reports from at least two major international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or Al Jazeera) of large protests in Canada specifically in response to the government's decision to change environmental policies. question.title: Will the United States maintain a 100% tariff on Chinese-made textiles through August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States continues to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff is reduced below 100% or completely removed at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, as of August 31, 2024, the United States does not continue to impose a 100% tariff on imports of Chinese-made textiles. The existence and rate of the tariff must be verifiable through official U.S. government sources (such as the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and corroborated by at least two reputable news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, The New York Times). If the tariff on either textiles or footwear is maintained at 100% at any point up to and including August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are explicitly stated to be temporary and do not permanently alter the 100% rate will not affect the resolution of this question.

para_P.title: Will the U.S. keep a 100% tariff on Chinese textiles or footwear until August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by August 31, 2024, the U.S. is still enforcing a 100% tariff on imports of either textiles or footwear produced in China. The presence and amount of the tariff must be confirmed through official sources from the U.S. government (like the Office of the United States Trade Representative or the U.S. Department of Commerce) and supported by at least two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, The Wall Street Journal, or The New York Times). If the tariff on both textiles and footwear is lowered below 100% or completely eliminated at any time up to and including August 31, 2024, the answer will be NO. Temporary suspensions or waivers of the tariff that are clearly labeled as temporary and do not permanently change the 100% rate will not influence the outcome of this question.

question.title: Will Kansas hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. The referendum must be related to enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution or significantly altering existing abortion laws. For a YES resolution, the referendum must be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If no such referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely scheduling a future referendum beyond the resolution date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

not_P.title: Will Kansas not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Kansas does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of abortion rights. For a YES resolution, the referendum must not be officially announced by the Kansas state government and the voting process must not be completed by the resolution date. The occurrence and results of the referendum must not be reported by at least two major, reputable news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major national newspapers). If such a referendum is held or completed by July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. para_P.title: Will there be a statewide vote in Kansas regarding abortion rights before July 2024?

question.title: Will the Bank of Canada announce an interest rate cut by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the Bank of Canada officially announces an interest rate cut to take effect by August 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed by official Bank of Canada communications, such as press releases, Governing Council statements, or public speeches by Bank officials. If no such announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO. Note that the actual implementation date of the rate cut can be after August 31, 2024, as long as the announcement itself occurs by that date. The interest rate in question refers to the overnight rate, which is the Bank of Canada's primary tool for monetary policy.

question.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Louisiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from a Louisiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

not_P.title: Will Louisiana's near-total abortion ban not be declared constitutional by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms that Louisiana's near-total abortion ban is unconstitutional. question.title: Will Missouri conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Missouri.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

question.title: Will Virginia's Medicaid plan with work requirements enroll at least 25,000 beneficiaries by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Virginia's Medicaid plan, which includes a work requirement, has enrolled at least 25,000 low-income residents. Enrollment figures must be confirmed by official state reports, the Virginia Department of Medical Assistance Services, or at least three widely recognized news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The plan must maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. If the enrollment is below 25,000 by the resolution date, or if the work requirement is removed from the plan, the question resolves as NO. In case of any legal challenges or federal interventions that significantly alter the plan's structure or implementation, the question will still resolve based on the enrollment numbers of the original plan or its closest equivalent.

The plan must not maintain its work requirement feature throughout the period. question.title: Will Apple Inc. resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Apple Inc. reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Apple Inc. workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Apple Inc. and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Pedro Sánchez continues to hold the position of Prime Minister of Spain through July 31, 2024. question.title: Will Nigeria's Senate pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate passes a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If no such bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed but does not meet all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Nigeria's Senate not pass a major economic reform bill opposed by President Tinubu by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate does not pass a major economic reform bill that is explicitly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The bill must not be related to economic policy, such as fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must not be passed by the Senate, regardless of whether it becomes law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must not be clearly reported by at least two major international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The bill must not be described as 'major' or 'significant' by these news sources in terms of its potential impact on the Nigerian economy.

If such a bill is passed by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is passed that meets all the above criteria, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for Nigeria's Senate to approve a significant economic reform legislation that President Tinubu opposes before August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered YES if, by August 31, 2024, Nigeria's Senate approves a significant economic reform legislation that is directly opposed by President Bola Tinubu or his administration. To qualify:

1. The legislation must pertain to economic policy, including aspects like fiscal spending, taxation, or monetary policy.
2. It must be approved by the Senate, irrespective of whether it is enacted into law.
3. The opposition from President Tinubu or his administration must be clearly documented by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Financial Times).
4. The legislation must be characterized as 'major' or 'significant' by these news outlets regarding its potential effects on the Nigerian economy.

If no such legislation is approved by the Senate by August 31, 2024, or if a bill is approved but fails to meet all the aforementioned criteria, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Bayer allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer officially announces or confirms that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively not enforcing its patent. This could be through a formal patent withdrawal, a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that allows for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If no such announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer continues to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Bayer not allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, Bayer does not officially announce or confirm that it will allow generic production of its cardiovascular drug, effectively enforcing its patent. This could be through a lack of formal patent withdrawal, a lack of a voluntary license agreement, or any other mechanism that does not allow for unrestricted generic production. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, statements from relevant regulatory bodies, or reports by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If such an announcement or confirmation is made by the specified date, or if Bayer does not continue to enforce its patent rights, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Bayer permit the production of generics for its heart medication by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will resolve positively if, by the end of July 2024, Bayer makes an official declaration or verification that it will permit the production of generics for its heart medication, thereby choosing not to enforce its patent. This could occur through a formal withdrawal of the patent, a voluntary licensing arrangement, or any other method that facilitates unrestricted generic manufacturing. Confirmation must be derived from official announcements by the company, statements from pertinent regulatory authorities, or reports from at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or major national newspapers). If there is no such announcement or confirmation by the given date, or if Bayer continues to uphold its patent rights, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

question.title: Will TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations be reported for spreading election misinformation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that TikTok's AI-driven content recommendations are spreading election misinformation. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention TikTok's AI and its role in spreading election misinformation. question.title: Will the Chinese battery company's factory project in Michigan be canceled by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, it is confirmed that the Chinese lithium-ion battery company's plan to build a $2.36 billion factory in Big Rapids, Michigan has been officially canceled. Confirmation must come from official statements by the company, the state of Michigan, or at least two credible news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The cancellation must be a complete termination of the project, not just a delay or modification. If the project is still ongoing, under review, or has not been officially canceled by this date, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, 'cancellation' means the company has formally withdrawn its plans or the state has definitively rejected the project.

question.title: Will the average rate on a 15-year mortgage in the US fall below 5.0% by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey, falls below 5.0% at any point. The rate must be confirmed by official reports from Freddie Mac or at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. If the rate does not fall below 5.0% by the specified date, or if Freddie Mac discontinues reporting this metric, the question will resolve as NO. For clarity, a rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Jerome Powell is still serving as the Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024. If he is no longer serving as Chair by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Chair appointments will not be considered as Powell remaining in the position.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if at least one of the following occurs: (a) By August 31, 2024, the average rate on a 15-year fixed-rate mortgage in the United States falls below 5.0% at any point, as reported by Freddie Mac in their Primary Mortgage Market Survey or confirmed by at least two reputable financial news sources such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC. A rate of exactly 5.0% will not be considered as falling below 5.0%. (b) Jerome Powell remains serving as the Chair of the Federal Reserve on July 31, 2024, as confirmed by official Federal Reserve announcements or reported by at least two major news outlets such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg. If either of these conditions is met, the question resolves as YES. If neither occurs, it resolves as NO.

question.title: Will Missouri hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?

The referendum must be formally announced by the Missouri state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major Missouri-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in Missouri and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. question.title: Will the United States report a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the United States officially reports a bumper harvest for both corn and soybeans, indicating higher than average yields compared to the previous five-year average. A bumper harvest is defined as a crop yield that is significantly above average, typically at least 10% higher than the five-year average. Confirmation must come from official reports by the United States Department of Agriculture (USDA) or at least three reputable news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, or The Wall Street Journal). If a bumper harvest is reported for only one of the crops (either corn or soybeans) but not both, or if no bumper harvest is reported for either crop, the question resolves as NO.

4. Reports from at least three major news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, CNN, New York Times) citing official sources

(a) There are no credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a major social media platform is spreading election misinformation through its AI systems. For the purpose of this question, 'election misinformation' refers to false or misleading information about election processes, candidates, or results. No credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The reports or warnings must specifically mention the platform and its AI systems' role in spreading election misinformation.

(b) Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro does not make a public statement specifically condemning the attack on Maria Corina Machado's headquarters that occurred in 2023. The statement must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must not be explicit and unambiguous, directly addressing the attack on Machado's headquarters.

If either (a) or (b) occurs by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By August 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) A significant social media platform is accused of disseminating election-related misinformation via its AI technologies, or (b) Nicolas Maduro openly criticizes the assault on Maria Corina Machado's office?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be deemed YES if at least one of the following takes place by August 31, 2024:

(a) There are trustworthy accounts or formal alerts from electoral officials, governmental bodies, or respected news organizations indicating that a significant social media platform is distributing election-related misinformation through its AI technologies. For this inquiry, 'election-related misinformation' pertains to inaccurate or deceptive information regarding electoral procedures, candidates, or outcomes. Trustworthy accounts should originate from a minimum of two of the following sources: state or federal electoral officials, prominent news outlets (like Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed research published in credible journals. The accounts or alerts must specifically cite the platform and its AI technologies' involvement in disseminating election-related misinformation.

(b) Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro issues a public remark explicitly denouncing the assault on Maria Corina Machado's office that took place in 2023. The remark must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (such as Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, or similar). The condemnation must be clear and direct, specifically addressing the assault on Machado's office.

If neither (a) nor (b) takes place by the resolution date, the inquiry will be deemed NO.

question.title: Will California receive over $300 million in federal grants for electric vehicle projects by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the state of California is confirmed to have been awarded more than $300 million in federal grants specifically for electric vehicle manufacturing, assembly, or related projects. Confirmation must come from official U.S. government sources (such as the Department of Energy or the White House) or be reported by at least two major national news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Wall Street Journal). The grants must be explicitly designated for electric vehicle-related initiatives within California. If the total amount of such grants awarded to California does not exceed $300 million by the specified date, or if there is insufficient evidence to confirm such an award, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Virginia maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

not_P.title: Will Virginia not maintain its current legal stance on abortion access by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has reversed or significantly altered its 2023 decision that struck down state laws regulating abortion providers more strictly than other health care providers and banned a common second-trimester procedure. The question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has not reversed this decision, reinstated stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the ban on the second-trimester procedure. The resolution will be based on official court decisions or credible reports from at least three major news organizations (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

para_P.title: Will Virginia uphold its existing legal position regarding abortion access by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has neither overturned nor substantially modified its 2023 ruling that invalidated state laws imposing stricter regulations on abortion providers compared to other healthcare providers and prohibited a common procedure in the second trimester. Conversely, the question will resolve as NO if, by July 31, 2024, the Virginia Supreme Court has overturned this ruling, reintroduced stricter regulations on abortion providers, or reinstated the prohibition on the second-trimester procedure. The determination will rely on official court rulings or credible reports from a minimum of three major news outlets (e.g., Associated Press, Reuters, The New York Times, The Washington Post).

question.title: Will IBM lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a lower number of layoffs, or if no such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Partial layoffs or phased implementations that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a NO resolution.

not_P.title: Will IBM not lay off at least 1,800 employees by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has not confirmed the layoff of at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan. Confirmation must not come from official company announcements, regulatory filings, or reports by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The layoffs must not be explicitly linked to the AI-focused reorganization plan announced in 2023. If IBM confirms a higher number of layoffs, or if such confirmation meeting these criteria is made by the resolution date, the question will resolve as NO. Confirmed layoffs that do not reach the 1,800 employee threshold by the resolution date will also result in a YES resolution.

para_P.title: Will IBM terminate at least 1,800 staff members by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, IBM has officially acknowledged the termination of no fewer than 1,800 staff members as part of its reorganization strategy focused on AI. Confirmation must be sourced from official company communications, regulatory submissions, or reports from a minimum of two credible news outlets (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The terminations must be directly associated with the AI-centric reorganization plan that was revealed in 2023. If IBM verifies a smaller number of terminations, or if there is no confirmation that meets these stipulated criteria by the resolution deadline, the inquiry will be resolved as negative. Any partial terminations or staged implementations that do not achieve the 1,800 employee count by the resolution date will also lead to a negative resolution.

question.title: Will Tiff Macklem remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada through July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tiff Macklem is still serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. Confirmation must come from official Bank of Canada announcements or be reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Reuters, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, or Bloomberg). If he is no longer serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Macklem remaining in the position.

not_P.title: Will Tiff Macklem not remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada through July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if Tiff Macklem is not serving as the Governor of the Bank of Canada on July 31, 2024. If he is still serving as Governor by the resolution date for any reason (including but not limited to resignation, removal, or end of term), the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not be considered as Macklem remaining in the position.

para_P.title: Will Tiff Macklem continue as the Governor of the Bank of Canada until the end of July 2024?

For the purposes of this inquiry, any interim or acting Governor appointments will not count as Macklem still holding the position.

question.title: Will either of the following occur by July 2024: (a) IBM will lay off at least 1,800 employees as part of its AI-focused reorganization plan, or (b) Tiff Macklem will remain as Governor of the Bank of Canada?

para_P.title: By July 2024, will one of the following happen: (a) IBM will terminate a minimum of 1,800 employees as part of its AI-centric restructuring strategy, or (b) Tiff Macklem will continue to be the Governor of the Bank of Canada?

If neither of these scenarios occurs by the resolution date, the answer will be NO.

question.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will a major hospital system in the Northeast US not cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, does not successfully cancel more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must not be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should not target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is more than $300 million, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible for a significant healthcare provider in the Northeastern United States to eliminate more than $300 million in medical debt by August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if, by the end of August 2024, a healthcare provider located in the Northeast US, in partnership with a nonprofit organization, effectively cancels over $300 million in medical debt for a minimum of 150,000 patients across various Northeastern states. The cancellation must be publicly declared by the healthcare provider or reported by at least two prominent news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt forgiveness should focus on patients deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to afford payment. If the debt cancellation is not finalized or officially verified by the given deadline, or if the total amount forgiven is $300 million or less, the resolution will be NO.

question.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company not resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company does not reach an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the continuation of a significant strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be considered valid:

1. The strike must not involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (less than 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must not last for at least one week.
3. The resolution must not be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union.
4. The resolution must not be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will Hyundai Motor Company come to an agreement to end a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry resolves as YES if Hyundai Motor Company successfully negotiates with unionized employees, leading to the conclusion of a major strike by July 31, 2024. For the resolution to be deemed valid:

1. The strike must involve a considerable number of Hyundai Motor Company employees (at least 1,000 participants).
2. The strike must endure for a minimum of one week.
3. The resolution must be validated by official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the participating union.
4. The resolution must be reported by no fewer than two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC).

If no such resolution that meets all these criteria is reached by the given date, or if no major strike takes place, the inquiry resolves as NO.

question.title: Will either a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, or Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
question.body:
This question resolves as YES if at least one of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is not completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, this part resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

The combined question resolves as YES if either part (a) or part (b) resolves as YES.

not_P.title: Will neither a major hospital system in the Northeast US cancel over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, nor Hyundai Motor Company resolve a major workers' strike by July 2024?
not_P.body:
This question resolves as YES if neither of the following occurs:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital system based in the Northeast United States, in collaboration with a nonprofit organization, successfully cancels more than $300 million in medical debt for at least 150,000 patients across multiple Northeastern states. The cancellation must be officially announced by the hospital system or reported by at least two major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major national newspapers). The debt cancellation should target patients who are considered financially needy or unable to pay. If the debt cancellation is completed or officially confirmed by the specified date, or if the amount cancelled is $300 million or less, this part resolves as YES.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Hyundai Motor Company reaches an agreement with unionized workers, resulting in the end of a significant strike. For the resolution to be considered valid, the strike must involve a substantial number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for at least one week, and the resolution must be confirmed by official statements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the involved union. Additionally, the resolution must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If such a resolution meeting all these criteria is achieved by the specified date, or if a significant strike occurs, this part resolves as YES.

The combined question resolves as YES if both parts (a) and (b) resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Is it possible that a prominent hospital network in the Northeastern United States will eliminate over $300 million in medical debt by August 2024, or that Hyundai Motor Company will conclude a significant workers' strike by July 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with YES if at least one of the following conditions is met:

(a) By August 31, 2024, a hospital network located in the Northeastern United States, in partnership with a nonprofit organization, successfully forgives more than $300 million in medical debt for a minimum of 150,000 patients across various states in the Northeast. The debt forgiveness must be officially announced by the hospital network or reported by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or leading national newspapers). The debt relief should focus on patients deemed financially disadvantaged or unable to pay. If the debt forgiveness is not completed or officially verified by the specified deadline, or if the amount forgiven is $300 million or less, this segment resolves as NO.

(b) By July 31, 2024, Hyundai Motor Company comes to a settlement with unionized workers, thereby ending a significant strike. For this resolution to be valid, the strike must involve a considerable number of Hyundai Motor Company workers (at least 1,000 participants), last for a minimum of one week, and the resolution must be confirmed through official announcements from both Hyundai Motor Company and the relevant union. Furthermore, the resolution must be reported by at least two credible international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, AP, Bloomberg, BBC). If no such resolution that meets all these criteria is reached by the specified date, or if no significant strike occurs, this part resolves as NO.

The overall question will be answered with YES if either segment (a) or segment (b) resolves as YES.

question.title: Will the Indian economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the Indian economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India. The question resolves as NO if the Indian economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

The absence of an announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the Swiss National Bank or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Governing Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual SNB members will not count for resolution. If such an official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will the Swiss National Bank declare a reduction in interest rates before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be answered with a YES if the Swiss National Bank publicly reveals a cut in its policy rate by July 31, 2024. The interest rate reduction must be an official decision made by the Governing Board and conveyed in their formal statement or press conference following a meeting. Any conjecture regarding future rate reductions or unofficial comments from individual SNB members will not be considered for resolution. If no such formal announcement of an interest rate reduction occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will either the Indian economy avoid a recession or the Swiss National Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if either of the following occurs by July 31, 2024: (a) The Indian economy does not enter a recession, defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth, as reported by the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation of India, between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024. (b) The Swiss National Bank officially announces a decrease in its policy rate, confirmed through official statements or reported by at least two major financial news sources, with the decision made by the Governing Board and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. If neither of these events occurs by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

question.title: Will the World Health Organization declare the current SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares the ongoing SARS-CoV-2 outbreak over by August 31, 2024. The declaration must be confirmed through official WHO announcements or reports from at least three reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Associated Press, or BBC). The outbreak referred to in this question is the one that prompted the WHO to declare a Public Health Emergency of International Concern. If no such declaration ending the outbreak is made by the resolution date, or if the WHO extends the emergency status beyond August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO.
