question.title: Will the Bahraini health ministry confirm more than one case of polio in Manama by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the Bahraini health ministry officially confirms more than one case of polio in Manama. For the purpose of this question:

1. Confirmation must come from official Bahraini health ministry reports or statements.
2. The confirmation must be reported by at least two reputable international news sources (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, Al Jazeera).
3. The cases must be new and separate from any cases reported before October 1, 2023.
4. Only cases within the geographical boundaries of Manama will be considered.
5. The type of polio (wild poliovirus or vaccine-derived poliovirus) does not matter for this question.

If no additional cases beyond the first are confirmed by the specified date, or if only one case in total is confirmed, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana conduct a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Indiana conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a YES resolution, the following criteria must be met:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the state of Indiana.
2. The primary focus of the referendum must be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

If no such referendum meeting these criteria occurs by August 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that merely proposing or planning a referendum without actually conducting it by the specified date does not qualify for a YES resolution.

2. The primary focus of the referendum must not be on abortion rights protection.
3. The referendum results must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

para_P.body:

A mere hint or speculation about future rate cuts does not qualify; there must be a concrete announcement of an actual rate reduction. If no such announcement is made by the specified date, this part resolves as YES. (b) Brazil records a monthly job growth figure below 50,000 in any official jobs report by July 31, 2024. The data must be confirmed by the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics in their monthly employment reports. Job growth refers to the net change in employment. Revisions to previous months' data will not be considered for this question's resolution. If job growth does fall below 50,000 in any month from October 2023 through July 2024, this part resolves as YES.

Changes to previously reported data will not be taken into account for the resolution of this question. question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a Charlotte rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will Kamala Harris not announce her running mate at a rally in Charlotte by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris does not publicly announce her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in Charlotte, North Carolina. The event and announcement must not be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does make such an announcement at a Charlotte rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: Will Vice President Kamala Harris disclose her choice for running mate during a rally in Charlotte before August 2024?

If Harris fails to make such an announcement at a rally in Charlotte by the conclusion of August 2024, or if the announcement is delivered through alternative means or at a different venue, the question will be answered with NO.

question.title: Will Minnesota hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Minnesota officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Minnesota state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

2. The referendum must not explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. Such a referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, and it specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Minnesota regarding abortion rights before August 2024?
para_P.body:

1. The public vote must be officially declared and executed by the Minnesota state authorities.
2. The public vote must directly tackle the matter of safeguarding abortion rights.
3. The outcomes of the public vote must be disclosed through official state communications or well-known news outlets.

The inquiry will conclude as NO if:

1. No such public vote takes place by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled public vote is called off or delayed beyond the designated date.
3. A public vote occurs, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not evaluate the result of the public vote, only whether it happens within the given timeframe.

question.title: Will the UK economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the UK economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The question resolves as NO if the UK economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Will the UK economy steer clear of a recession by July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by July 31, 2024, the UK economy does not fall into a recession. For the purposes of this inquiry, a recession is characterized as two successive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by the UK's Office for National Statistics. The inquiry will be deemed negative if the UK economy undergoes two successive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will PepsiCo report increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If no such increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports continued decline or stagnation in demand for its beverage products in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

not_P.title: Will PepsiCo report no increased North American demand for its beverage products by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo does not report an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023. The lack of increase must be confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources (such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal). The demand increase should not be explicitly stated or clearly implied in the company's financial results or official communications. If such an increase is reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo reports a continued increase in demand for its beverage products in North America, the question will resolve as NO.

para_P.title: By July 2024, will there be a reported rise in North American demand for PepsiCo's beverage offerings?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be deemed YES if, by July 31, 2024, PepsiCo indicates a rise in North American demand for its beverage offerings when compared to the demand figures from the second quarter of 2023. The increase in demand should be clearly articulated or strongly suggested in the company's financial disclosures or official statements. If there is no such rise reported by the specified date, or if PepsiCo indicates a continued decline or stagnation in demand for its beverage offerings in North America, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

(b) PepsiCo reports an increase in North American demand for its beverage products compared to the demand reported in the second quarter of 2023, confirmed through official company earnings reports or statements from PepsiCo and reported by at least two reputable news sources such as Reuters, Bloomberg, CNBC, or The Wall Street Journal. question.title: Will Rome announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the city government of Rome officially announces plans or regulations aimed at restricting or limiting the availability of short-term rental units (such as those typically listed on platforms like Airbnb) within the city. The announcement must come from an official source within Rome's local government and be reported by at least two reputable international news organizations. The restrictions or regulations should be specifically targeted at reducing the number of short-term rental units available to tourists or altering the way they operate. Mere discussions or proposals without a formal announcement will not be sufficient for a YES resolution. If no such official announcement is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Rome not announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?

question.title: Will the European Central Bank announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if the European Central Bank officially announces a decrease in its main refinancing operations rate by July 31, 2024. The announcement must be confirmed through official statements from the ECB or reported by at least two major financial news sources (such as Bloomberg, Reuters, The Wall Street Journal, or CNBC). The interest rate cut must be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. If no such official announcement of an interest rate cut is made by the resolution date, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will the European Central Bank not announce an interest rate cut by July 2024?

The interest rate cut must not be a formal decision made by the Governing Council of the ECB and communicated in their official statement or press conference following a meeting. Any speculation about future rate cuts or unofficial statements by individual ECB members will not count for resolution. question.title: Will Illinois hold a referendum on healthcare reform by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the state of Illinois officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enacting healthcare reform in the state. The referendum must be officially announced by the Illinois Secretary of State or other appropriate state election authority, and must be scheduled to take place on or before August 31, 2024. The referendum question must directly address the issue of healthcare reform. This question will resolve as NO if no such referendum is officially announced or conducted by the specified date. Note that merely gathering signatures for a potential referendum does not qualify for a YES resolution; the actual referendum must be scheduled or held within the specified timeframe.

question.title: Will another U.S. state adopt a Medicaid plan with a health savings account requirement by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, at least one U.S. state other than Georgia officially adopts a Medicaid plan that includes a health savings account requirement for beneficiaries. For a positive resolution, there must be an official announcement from the state government or the state's Medicaid agency, or consistent reporting from at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, or Washington Post). question.title: Will Buenos Aires announce plans to restrict short-term rental units by July 2024?

question.body: This question resolves as YES if, at any point during August 2024, the average rate on a 30-year fixed-rate mortgage, as reported by Freddie Mac in its Primary Mortgage Market Survey, exceeds 7.0%. question.title: Will Florida hold a referendum on abortion rights by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Florida officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on enshrining protection for abortion rights in the state. For a positive resolution:

1. The referendum must be officially announced and conducted by the Florida state government.
2. The referendum must explicitly address the issue of abortion rights protection.
3. The results of the referendum must be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. No such referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held, but it does not specifically focus on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it takes place within the specified timeframe.

3. The results of the referendum must not be publicly reported by official state channels or widely recognized news sources.

The question will resolve as NO if:

1. Such a referendum occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond the specified date.
3. A referendum is held that specifically focuses on enshrining protection for abortion rights.

Note: This question does not consider the outcome of the referendum, only whether it does not take place within the specified timeframe.

para_P.body:

3. The outcomes of the vote must be disclosed through official state announcements or reputable news outlets.

The inquiry will be marked as NO if:

1. No such public vote occurs by August 31, 2024.
2. A scheduled vote is called off or delayed past the designated date.
3. A vote takes place, but it does not specifically aim at establishing protections for abortion rights.

Note: This inquiry does not take into account the results of the public vote, only whether it is conducted within the given timeframe.

question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, there are credible reports or official warnings from election officials, government authorities, or reputable news organizations stating that a new AI platform is spreading election misinformation. Credible reports should come from at least two of the following sources: state or federal election officials, major news outlets (such as Associated Press, Reuters, BBC, or major US networks), or peer-reviewed studies published in reputable journals. The grant must be explicitly designated for the endowments of these institutions. If neither of these scenarios occurs by the resolution date, the inquiry will be resolved as NO.

question.title: Will Indiana's near-total abortion ban be declared constitutional by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, a court ruling confirms the constitutionality of Indiana's near-total abortion ban. The confirmation must come from an Indiana state court and be reported by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, or major US newspapers). If the ban is not declared constitutional by the specified date, or if a court rules it unconstitutional, the question resolves as NO. For the purpose of this question, a 'near-total abortion ban' refers to the law that was blocked and is pending assessment, as mentioned in the article dated October 1, 2023.

question.title: Will Kamala Harris announce her running mate at a rally in San Francisco by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Vice President Kamala Harris publicly announces her running mate for the upcoming election at a rally held in San Francisco, California. The announcement must be made by Harris herself during the rally and must clearly identify the individual chosen as her running mate. The event and announcement must be confirmed by at least two reputable national news sources (such as Associated Press, Reuters, New York Times, Washington Post, CNN, or Fox News) within 24 hours of the rally. If Harris does not make such an announcement at a San Francisco rally by the end of August 2024, or if the announcement is made through other means or at a different location, the question will resolve as NO.

question.title: Will the South Korean economy avoid a recession by July 2024?
question.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy does not enter a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy experiences two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the South Korean economy enter a recession by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question resolves as YES if, by July 31, 2024, the South Korean economy enters a recession. For the purpose of this question, a recession is defined as two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The question resolves as NO if the South Korean economy does not experience two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any point between October 1, 2023, and July 31, 2024.

para_P.title: Can the South Korean economy steer clear of a recession before July 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be affirmed as YES if, by the end of July 2024, the South Korean economy has not entered a recession. For the purposes of this query, a recession is characterized by two successive quarters of declining GDP growth as reported by Statistics Korea. The inquiry will be marked as NO if the South Korean economy undergoes two consecutive quarters of negative GDP growth at any time from October 1, 2023, to July 31, 2024.

question.title: Will the WHO declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
question.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially declares that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, not a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does not make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that does not specifically address the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak no longer a global emergency prior to this question's start date, the question will still resolve based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

not_P.title: Will the WHO not declare the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria no longer a global emergency by August 2024?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) does not officially declare that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer considered a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must not make a public announcement explicitly stating that the Lassa fever outbreak in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency.
2. This declaration must not be reported by at least two major international news outlets (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The declaration must not specifically refer to the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak, but rather to a global Lassa fever situation in general.

The question will resolve as NO if:
1. The WHO does make such a declaration by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO makes a declaration about Lassa fever that specifically addresses the Nigerian outbreak.
3. The WHO maintains or escalates the emergency status of the Nigerian Lassa fever outbreak.

para_P.title: Will the World Health Organization announce that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer a global emergency by the end of August 2024?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as YES if, by August 31, 2024, the World Health Organization (WHO) officially states that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer regarded as a global emergency. For a YES resolution:

1. The WHO must issue a public statement clearly indicating that the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria is no longer deemed a global emergency.
2. This announcement must be covered by at least two prominent international news organizations (e.g., Reuters, Associated Press, BBC, CNN).
3. The announcement must specifically mention the Lassa fever situation in Nigeria, rather than a general global Lassa fever context.

The inquiry will conclude as NO if:
1. The WHO fails to make such an announcement by August 31, 2024.
2. The WHO issues a statement regarding Lassa fever that does not specifically pertain to the Nigerian situation.
3. The WHO continues or intensifies the emergency designation of the Nigerian Lassa fever situation.

Note: If the WHO has already declared the Nigerian Lassa fever situation no longer a global emergency before the start date of this inquiry, the conclusion will still be based on the status as of August 31, 2024.

question.title: Will Colorado hold a referendum on cannabis regulation by August 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado officially conducts a public referendum specifically focused on cannabis regulation. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address cannabis regulation, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on cannabis does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If no such referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

not_P.title: Will Colorado not hold a referendum on cannabis regulation by August 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado does not officially conduct a public referendum specifically focused on cannabis regulation. The referendum must be a statewide vote, officially organized by the state government, and the results must be publicly reported by credible news sources or official state channels. The referendum topic must directly address cannabis regulation, either proposing new measures or altering existing policies. A general election that includes candidates with differing stances on cannabis does not qualify; it must be a specific referendum on the issue. If such a referendum occurs by the specified date, or if a planned referendum is not cancelled or postponed beyond August 31, 2024, the question resolves as NO.

para_P.title: Will there be a public vote in Colorado regarding cannabis regulation before August 2024?
para_P.body: This inquiry will be considered affirmative if, by August 31, 2024, Colorado carries out an official public vote that specifically addresses cannabis regulation. The vote must be a statewide initiative, properly organized by the state authorities, and the outcomes must be reported by reliable news outlets or official state communication channels. The subject of the vote must directly pertain to cannabis regulation, whether it involves introducing new regulations or modifying existing ones. A general election featuring candidates with varying views on cannabis does not meet this criterion; it must be a distinct vote on the matter. If such a vote does not take place by the designated date, or if a scheduled vote is canceled or delayed past August 31, 2024, the inquiry will be deemed negative.

question.title: Will New York hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
question.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, New York officially conducts a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must be formally announced by the New York state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major New York-based news outlets). The referendum must be open to all eligible voters in New York and focus primarily on abortion rights. If no such referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

not_P.title: Will New York not hold a referendum on abortion rights by July 2024?
not_P.body: This question will resolve as YES if, by July 31, 2024, New York does not officially conduct a statewide referendum specifically on the topic of enshrining abortion rights in the state constitution. The referendum must not be formally announced by the New York state government and verified by at least two major news organizations (such as Associated Press, Reuters, NPR, or major New York-based news outlets). The referendum must not be open to all eligible voters in New York and must not focus primarily on abortion rights. If such a referendum occurs or is completed by the resolution date, or if the referendum is not canceled or postponed beyond July 31, 2024, the question will resolve as NO. Note that this question only pertains to the occurrence of the referendum, not its outcome.

para_P.title: Will New York conduct a vote on abortion rights before July 2024?

The voting process must be accessible to all qualified voters in New York and should primarily address abortion rights. If such a vote does not happen or is not finalized by the resolution date, or if the vote is canceled or postponed past July 31, 2024, the inquiry will be answered with NO. Please note that this question only concerns the occurrence of the vote, not its result.
